title: Sara Acevedo
text:
Hi! I am an Assistant Professor at Pontificia Universidad Cat√≥lica de Chile and researcher at the Centre for Sustainable Urban Development, CEDEUS. My research is focused on soil science, soil physics and soil data analysis, specifically in the urban environment. You can check my last publications in ORCID and Google Scholar. Also, I‚Äôm the Editor-in-Chief of the International Journal of Agriculture and Natural Resources IJANR. IJANR is an open-access and public-good basis journal welcoming novelty and high-quality papers üìù
Also, I am developing R packages for the soil science community. {infiltrodiscR} for infiltration analysis is available on CRAN and {ggsoiltexture} for plotting soil texture is under development.
If you want to see what I am doing lately, you can check my Github account and the me now section!

text:

text:
üìù Publications and R packages
I am writing academic articles related to urban soils and soil physics. I am super proud of my colleagues Cristina Contreras and Carolina Giraldo, and together we have published cool new stuff.

library(scholar)
library(dplyr)

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

library(DT)

# Google Scholar ID (replace with yours)
id <- "WJqqnIQAAAAJ"

# Get and filter publications
pubs <- get_publications(id)
last_year <- as.numeric(format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")) - 1
pubs <- pubs %>% filter(year >= last_year)

# Select and rename columns
pubs_clean <- pubs %>%
  select(Title = title,
         Authors = author,
         Journal = journal,
         Year = year)

# Create searchable, downloadable table
datatable(
  pubs_clean,
  caption = paste("Publications from", last_year),
  extensions = "Buttons",
  options = list(
    dom = 'Bfrtip',
    pageLength = 5
  ),
  rownames = FALSE
)






I have developed two R packages: ggsoiltexture: Provides a simple ggplot function for the plotting of soil textural data and InfiltrodiscR: Provides functions for the modeling of data derived from the Minidisk Infiltrometer device.

title: Me now: 2024
text:
Inclusion and accesibility
I am interested in being a researcher who welcomes all her students and colleagues in an inclusive way. I am part of the Inclusion Committee in my Faculty and part of RLadiesGlobal, where I am learning how to teach and create more inclusive communities.
